page.title: 09 A YEAR OF FARMING
page.content: January is the time when most cows start calving.April is the start of lambing. By May most lambing has finished.The sheep that have lambs for the first time are called hogs.Most farmers start to make silage in June. June & July sees the end of most calving.August is the start of harvest. The corn is led to Jameson's Mill to make into cattle feeds. In November we open the silage pit and feed it to the cows and the hay to the calves through the Winter. Farms around Masham grow various crops including wheat,barley,potatoes, oil seed rape and cale.All the stock farmers have grass land.Farmers around Masham hire contractors to help out in the busy months.The most common piece of machinery hired is the Combine Harvester.
